DataElement.preferredName: Cell Genetic Engineering Non-Native Antigen Receptor Gene Expression Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not cells were engineered to express a non-native antigen receptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Genetic Engineering Non-Native Antigen Receptor Gene Expression Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._The technology of preparing recombinant DNA in vitro by cutting up DNA molecules and splicing together fragments from more than one organism._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A cell-surface receptor found on T-cells or B-cells that recognize specific antigenic peptides. Each cell naturally produces a unique receptor that binds to a unique epitope on a target cell._Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:The technology of preparing recombinant DNA in vitro by cutting up DNA molecules and splicing together fragments from more than one organism.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

The application of genetic-based biotechnology to modify the characteristics of an organism by cutting, splicing, and transferring genetic materials, especially DNA, from one or more species of organism.

Property.preferredName: Negation Antigen Receptor Gene Expression Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A cell-surface receptor found on T-cells or B-cells that recognize specific antigenic peptides. Each cell naturally produces a unique receptor that binds to a unique epitope on a target cell.:Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A cell-surface receptor found on T-cells or B-cells that recognize specific antigenic peptides. Each cell naturally produces a unique receptor that binds to a unique epitope on a target cell.
Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
